intro: Temnadenia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf temnadenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Temnadenia cordata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
